type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: An important event in the history, or progress of something.
examples: He felt that moving out of his parents' house was a real milestone in his life.
The team was elated to finally reach the milestone of one million subscribers.
The birth of a child is a significant milestone for many people.
Many people consider turning 50 years old to be a major milestone.
Receiving her degree was a milestone moment in her life.

es.definition: Usado para indicar la ubicación o posición dentro de algo.

pt.definition: Usado para indicar a localização ou posição dentro de alguma coisa.

type_word.name: Preposition
type_word.description: Words used before a noun or pronoun to form a phrase modifying another word in the sentence.

definition: Used to indicate location or position within something.
examples: He is waiting at the bus stop.
I work at a hospital.
She is skilled at sewing.
She arrived at eight o'clock.
Look at that!

es.definition: De manera espontánea, sin planificación o preparación previa.

pt.definition: De forma espontânea, sem planejamento ou preparação prévia.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In a spontaneous manner, without any prior planning or preparation.
examples: The crowd spontaneously burst into applause.
He spontaneously decided to take a day off from work.
The protest started spontaneously, with no formal organization.
She spontaneously broke into song in the middle of the party.
The idea for the business came to him spontaneously.

es.definition: Provocar o animar a alguien a hacer algo, especialmente algo malo.

pt.definition: Provocar ou encorajar alguém a fazer algo, especialmente algo mau.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To provoke or encourage someone to do something, especially something naughty or illicit.
examples: She was instigating him to break the rule.
The event was instigating a lot of people to protest.
Instigating violence is punishable by law.
He was known for instigating conflicts in the group.
They were instigating the crowd against the authorities.

es.definition: Un viaje largo, sobre todo por mar, o al espacio.

pt.definition: Uma viagem longa, principalmente por mar ou para o espaço.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A long journey, especially by sea or to space.
examples: A voyage across the sea can be a great adventure.
The author documented his voyage to the Arctic in a best-selling book.
The spacecraft is ready for its voyage to Mars.
She returned home after a long voyage around the world.
The sailors prepared for their voyage.

es.definition: Relacionado con el mundo material, en lugar de con aspectos espirituales o religiosos.

pt.definition: Relacionado com o mundo material, em vez de os aspectos espirituais ou religiosos.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Related to the world or worldly things as distinct from spiritual or religious aspects.
examples: She was tired of the mundane tasks of day-to-day life.
There is a certain beauty in the mundane.
He found something spiritual in the mundane activities of daily living.
He tried to find ways to make mundane tasks more interesting.

es.definition: Algo que se rompe o se mastica fácilmente y hace ruido, a menudo un alimento.

pt.definition: Algo que se quebra ou mastiga facilmente e faz barulho, geralmente um alimento.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Something that is easily breakable or chewed that makes noise, often a food.
examples: I love the crunchy texture of fresh vegetables in a salad.
The candy has a sweet, crunchy shell and a soft, chewy center.
He prefers crunchy peanut butter over smooth.
This bread is too stale, it's super crunchy.

es.definition: Participio de masticar. Se refiere a la acción de desmenuzar la comida con los dientes antes de deglutirla.

pt.definition: Particípio de mastigar. Refere-se à ação de triturar a comida com os dentes antes de engoli-la.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Past participle of chew. It refers to the action of grinding food with the teeth before swallowing it.
examples: I chewed my food thoroughly before swallowing.
The dog chewed on the bone for hours.
He chewed the ends of his mustache while thinking.

es.definition: Algo que no tiene una etiqueta o de lo que no se ha identificado una etiqueta.

pt.definition: Algo que não tem uma etiqueta ou cuja etiqueta não foi identificada.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Something that does not have a label or whose label has not been identified.
examples: Some unlabeled boxes were found in the storage room.
The artist released an unlabeled album to surprise his fans.
The unlabeled sample caused confusion in the lab.

es.definition: interesado mucho en algo, especialmente porque es misterioso

pt.definition: muito interessado em algo, especialmente porque é misterioso

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Very interested in something, especially because it is mysterious
examples: I am intrigued by his mysterious past.
She was intrigued by the strange symbol on the document.
His odd behavior intrigued the detectives.

es.definition: Participio pasado del verbo 'cantar'. Se refiere a la acción que se ha realizado de producir melodías con la voz.

pt.definition: Particípio passado do verbo 'cantar'. Refere-se à ação que foi realizada de produzir melodias com a voz.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

type_word.name: Past Participle
type_word.description: The form of a verb, typically ending in -ed in English, which is used in forming perfect and passive tenses and sometimes as an adjective.

definition: Past participle of 'sing'. Refers to the action that has been performed of producing melodies with the voice.
examples: She had sung at the opera house before she retired.
The national anthem was sung by a famous pop singer.
The lullaby was softly sung to the baby.
The song has been sung in many different languages.
The praise was sung by everyone present.

es.definition: Habitaciones grandes y espaciosas en un edificio público, como un hotel o un museo, a veces utilizadas para funciones.

pt.definition: Salas grandes e espaçosas em um prédio público, como um hotel ou museu, às vezes usadas para funções.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Large, spacious rooms in a public building, such as a hotel or museum, sometimes used for functions.
examples: The wedding reception was held in one of the grandest halls in the city.
The museum features a number of exhibition halls.
Her office is down the hall, first door on the right.
Many universities have dormitories or halls where students live on campus.

es.definition: Aquello que produce sensación de calma.

pt.definition: Isso que produz sensação de calma.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Having a gently calming effect.
examples: This is a soothing cup of tea.
Her voice was soothing.
The music was very soothing.
He gave a soothing answer.
This is a soothing piece of music.

es.definition: Llegar a cierto punto, grado, estado o resultado.

pt.definition: Chegar a um certo ponto, grau, estado ou resultado.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Arrive at; get as far as.
examples: If you work hard and apply yourself, you will reach your goals.
He reaches the finish line with a time of two hours.
The information reaches everybody in the town.
The mountaintop reaches into the clouds on rainy days.

es.definition: Realizar una representación gráfica de algo con una herramienta de escritura o dibujo.

pt.definition: Fazer uma representação gráfica de algo com um instrumento de escrita ou desenho.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To make a picture of something in a story using a tool for writing or drawing.
examples: The children have drawn pictures of animals.
He drew a bird on the whiteboard.
She drew her experiences in a diary.
This word is usually used in past tense, as it refers to an action that has been completed.

es.definition: Un término utilizado generalmente en el arte, como cuando varias imágenes o elementos son atraídos hacia un punto en común o se unen para formar una estructura de arte unificada.

pt.definition: Um termo geralmente usado na arte, como quando várias imagens ou elementos são atraídos para um ponto comum ou se unem para formar uma estrutura de arte unificada.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Palabras que expresan acciones, estados o procesos.

type_word.name: Particle
type_word.description: Una palabra que se une a un verbo para crear un verbo frasal, como 'up' en 'pick up'.

definition: A term generally used in art, such as when several images or elements are drawn towards a common point or come together to form a unified art structure.
examples: The different themes in the art exhibition were drawn together by a common thread.
He has a way of drawing together diverse elements to create a coherent argument.
The team was drawn together by their shared goals and passions.

es.definition: Acogedoramente situado, acomodado, especialmente en un lugar seguro y protegido.

pt.definition: Aconchegantemente situado, acomodado, especialmente em um lugar seguro e protegido.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Comfortably situated, accommodated, especially in a secure, protective place.
examples: The village is nestled in the hills.
The bird had nestled its eggs in a cozy spot in the tree.
Our hotel was nestled between the mountains, with amazing views all around

es.definition: Habilidad o experiencia excepcionales

pt.definition: Habilidade ou experiência excepcionais

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Exceptional or superior ability, skill, or strength.
examples: His prowess in the martial arts is well known.
She has a great prowess in dealing with animals.
The team's defensive prowess was the key to their victory.

es.definition: Expresar aprobación o admiración por (alguien o algo).

pt.definition: Expressar aprovação ou admiração por (alguém ou algo).

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Praise (a person or their achievements) highly.
examples: She was much lauded for her contribution to the team.
His work is lauded by critics and fans alike.
He has been lauded as the best actor of his generation.

es.definition: Usado para referirse a una cosa, animal, idea, etc., previamente mencionada o fácilmente identificada.

pt.definition: Usado para se referir a uma coisa, animal, ideia, etc., previamente mencionada ou facilmente identificada.

type_word.name: Pronoun
type_word.description: Words used in place of a noun.

definition: Used to refer to a thing, animal, idea, etc., previously mentioned or easily identified.
examples: It is raining outside.
I saw it on the news.
Can you hear it?
It's her birthday today.
I can't believe it!

es.definition: Hacer una acción o tarea.

pt.definition: Fazer uma ação ou tarefa.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: To carry out, accomplish, or fulfill (an action, task, or function).
examples: I have important tasks to perform.
She will perform a song.
The doctor had to perform surgery.

es.definition: Cada una de las ondulaciones que se forman en la superficie del agua por efecto del viento, de una perturbación, etc.

pt.definition: Cada uma das ondas que se formam na superfície da água devido ao vento, a uma perturbação, etc.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: Each of the ridges or crests moving across the surface of a body of water, caused by the wind, a disturbance, etc.
examples: The waves crashed against the shore.
He likes to surf the big waves.
Please, don't make waves.

es.definition: Algo que ha avanzado, crecido o mejorado a lo largo del tiempo

pt.definition: Algo que progrediu, cresceu ou melhorou ao longo do tempo

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Something that has advanced, grown, or improved over time
examples: The software has developed significantly since its first version.
The country developed its economy and now it is one of the richest in the world.
The student developed his skills and now is one of the best in class.

es.definition: Que existe desde hace mucho tiempo, en relación con la historia.

pt.definition: Que existe há muito tempo, em relação à história.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Belonging to the very distant past and no longer in existence.
examples: The ancient civilizations of the Mediterranean
I admired the ancient monuments in Rome.
He's an expert on ancient Egyptian literature.

es.definition: La cualidad de ser sofisticado, en términos de educación, gusto, modales y cultura.

pt.definition: A qualidade de ser sofisticado, em termos de educação, gosto, maneiras e cultura.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The quality of being sophisticated, in terms of education, taste, manners, and culture.
examples: Her sophistication is evident in her contemporary taste in clothing.
The city is known for its sophistication and culture.
His writings reveal a level of sophistication that is impressive.
They enjoyed the sophistication of the cuisine and fine wine.

es.definition: Producto de la actividad intelectual.

pt.definition: Produto da atividade intelectual.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The product of mental activity; that which one thinks.
examples: I just had a thought. Why don't we ask Tom?
She was lost in thought.
He threw a thought at me, but I wasn't ready to catch it.
His thought was on the game as he swung the club.

es.definition: Unidad de tiempo que equivale a doce meses.

pt.definition: Unidade de tempo equivalente a doze meses.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The time that it takes for the Earth to travel once around the Sun: a period of 365 days (or 366 days in a leap year).
examples: It's been years since I last saw her.
It took years to build the new road.
A child of six years is generally quite independent.
He's been working here for years and years.
I haven't seen her in years!

es.definition: afirmación falsa realizada con el propósito de engañar.

pt.definition: afirmação falsa feita com a intenção de enganar.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A false statement made with deliberate intent to deceive.
examples: She told a lot of lies about her past.
I hate being told lies.
He lives on the lies he tells to others.
The politician's promises turned out to be nothing but lies.

es.definition: La calidad de ser abierto a más de una interpretación; inexactitud.

pt.definition: A qualidade de ser aberto a mais de uma interpretação; inexatidão.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The quality of being open to more than one interpretation; inexactness.
examples: We can detect a certain amount of ambiguity in his reply.
Her letters were full of ambiguity about her intentions.
There remains some ambiguity in the law regarding this issue.
The ambiguity of the situation did not escape him.
The chairman's remarks clarified the ambiguity surrounding the company's future.

es.definition: Capacidad de entender o comprender algo.

pt.definition: Capacidade de entender ou compreender algo.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The ability to understand something; comprehension.
examples: The lecture was beyond my understanding.
We have a good understanding of the problem.
He shows an understanding of human nature.
Her little sister is not yet of an age to have an understanding of such things.
As a result of their understanding of each other, they became the best of friends.

es.definition: Usado para indicar una preferencia o elección entre dos o más opciones.

pt.definition: Usado para indicar uma preferência ou escolha entre duas ou mais opções.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: Used to express a preference or choice between two or more alternatives.
examples: I would rather not go to the party tonight.

I think I'd rather stay home and watch TV.

es.definition: Alude a la presentación exagerada de las noticias, sucesos, etc., con objetivos comerciales o propagandísticos.

pt.definition: Refere-se à apresentação exagerada de notícias, eventos, etc., com objetivos comerciais ou propagandistas.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Words that express actions, states, or processes.

definition: Refers to the exaggerated presentation of news, events, etc., for commercial or propagandistic purposes.
examples: The media often sensationalized the smallest incidents to attract viewers.
Many felt that the report on the incident was sensationalized to create unnecessary panic.
The event was sensationalized to the point that people were misled about it.
The crime was sensationalized in the press, prompting a public outcry.
The book sensationalized the reality of life in the industry, making it seem more glamorous than it really was.

es.definition: Predicción de lo que va a suceder en el futuro, especialmente cuando es anunciada por un profeta.

pt.definition: Previsão do que acontecerá no futuro, especialmente quando anunciado por um profeta.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: A prediction of what will happen in the future, especially one made by a prophet.
examples: The prophecy foretold of the great king's fall.
Her prophecy of doom was ignored by the populace.
His prophecy turned out to be eerily accurate.
The ancient prophecy spoke of a time of great turmoil.
She believed the prophecy, and it guided her actions.

es.definition: Forma conjugada del verbo 'haber' para indicar una situación hipotética, condicional o futura.

pt.definition: Forma conjugada do verbo 'haver' para indicar uma situação hipotética, condicional ou futura.

type_word.name: Modal Verb
type_word.description: A type of auxiliary verb that is used to indicate modality, such as likelihood, ability or permission.

definition: Used to express a hypothetical or uncertain situation in the past or future, or a polite form of saying 'will', or also used to express desire or request.
examples: I would go to the party if I had a car.
She said she would write the report all over again if necessary.
Would you like a cup of coffee?
Would you pass me the salt, please?

es.definition: En, por, cerca o relativo a una posición o lugar, usualmente cuando giras o te desplazas.

pt.definition: Em, por, perto ou relacionado a uma posição ou lugar, geralmente quando se gira ou se move.

type_word.name: Preposition
type_word.description: Words used before a noun or pronoun to form a phrase modifying another word in the sentence.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

definition: In, at, or to a position or place nearby, usually when you are circling it or moving from one side to the other, or used to express presence or use in particular situations.
examples: He turned around and walked away.
They were sitting around the dining table.
Around twenty people came to the meeting.
She likes to have her family around her at Christmas.
There's a lot of flu going around at the moment.

es.definition: Que atrae o mantiene fija la atención de manera poderosa.

pt.definition: Que atrai ou prende a atenção de maneira poderosa.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Powerfully attracting or holding the attention.
examples: She has a captivating smile.
His new book makes for a captivating read.
The movie was utterly captivating, from start to finish.

es.definition: El último día de la vida humana con juicios divinos y desastres naturales según diferentes creencias y enseñanzas religiosas.

pt.definition: O último dia da vida humana, com julgamentos divinos e desastres naturais, de acordo com diferentes crenças e ensinamentos religiosos.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The last day of human life with divine judgments and natural disasters according to different religious beliefs and teachings.
examples: Many people fear doomsday and have built bunkers to survive it.
The preacher told his followers that doomsday was near and they should repent.
The movie depicted a post-apocalyptic world where doomsday had already come and gone.

es.definition: Que ocurre de forma regular a intervalos de tiempo.

pt.definition: Ocorre de forma regular em intervalos de tempo.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Occurring regularly at each interval of time.
examples: The price of house tends to be cyclical, with periods of rapid increase followed by periods of decline.

The business world is known for its cyclical highs and lows.

es.definition: Que es auténtico, cierto, que coincide con la realidad.

pt.definition: Que é autêntico, certo, que coincide com a realidade.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: In accordance with fact or reality.
examples: It's not true that all dogs are aggressive.
If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.
True to his word, he arrived on time.
The true test of maturity is patience.

es.definition: Parte esencial o central de algo, en la que se concentra su fuerza, importancia o actividad principal.

pt.definition: Parte essencial ou central de algo, onde sua força, importância ou atividade principal está concentrada.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: The central or most important part of something, where the main strength, importance, or activity is concentrated.
examples: The core of the problem is the lack of communication between the teams.
The core principles of the company should guide its actions.
Exercise is vital for a strong core and good posture.
Getting to the core of an issue can often take time.

es.definition: el comienzo de algo nuevamente, especialmente después de que ha terminado o ha disminuido durante un tiempo

pt.definition: o início de algo novamente, especialmente depois de ter terminado ou diminuído por algum tempo

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: the start of something again, especially after it has ended or decreased for a period of time.
examples: They believe in reincarnation, the rebirth of the soul.
Spring is the season of rebirth.
The city is experiencing a rebirth of its downtown area.
With her recovery from addiction came a rebirth of her musical career.
The rebirth of the company is attributed to its innovative products.

es.definition: La humanidad se refiere a todas las personas en el mundo, tomadas colectivamente.

pt.definition: A humanidade refere-se a todas as pessoas no mundo, consideradas coletivamente.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: All people in the world, collectively viewed.
examples: The whole of humanity must respond to the environmental crisis
This medical discovery is a big step forward for humanity
His work has benefited humanity greatly
We need to preserve the humanity in ourselves
Their goal is to serve humanity

es.definition: De la etapa de la historia bíblica que precede a la inundación en los tiempos de Noé.

pt.definition: A fase da história bíblica antes do dilúvio nos tempos de Noé.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Of or belonging to the time before the biblical Flood.
examples: They believe in a literal interpretation of the Bible and that the earth is only about five thousand antediluvian years old.

His views on women are positively antediluvian.

es.definition: Que tiene características extrañas o inusuales, que se distingue de los demás por ellas.

pt.definition: Que tem características estranhas ou incomuns, que se distingue dos outros por elas.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Characterized by peculiar or unexpected traits.
examples: She's known for her quirky sense of humor.
He had a quirky smile that was quite endearing.
Her style is quirky but very popular.
I like the show's quirky sense of humor.

es.definition: Que es ominoso es un adjetivo utilizado para describir algo que es mal presagio o da la sensación de que algo malo va a suceder.

pt.definition: Ominoso é um adjetivo usado para descrever algo que é de mau presságio ou que dá a sensação de que algo ruim vai acontecer.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: Giving the impression that something bad or unpleasant is going to happen; threatening; inauspicious.
examples: There were ominous dark clouds gathering overhead.
The engine made an ominous grinding sound.
His ominous tone made me shiver.

es.definition: desarrollar sentimientos románticos intensos por alguien.

pt.definition: desenvolver sentimentos românticos intensos por alguém.

type_word.name: Phrase

definition: developing intense romantic feelings for someone.
examples: She is falling in love with him.
I started falling in love with her when we first met.
It's easy to start falling in love when you're on a romantic vacation.

es.definition: Animal que es cazado y asesinado por otro para la comida.

pt.definition: Animal que é caçado e morto por outro para comida.

type_word.name: Noun
type_word.description: Words that name people, animals, places, things, ideas, or phenomena.

definition: An animal that is hunted and killed by another for food.
examples: The lion stalks its prey in the tall grass.
The eagle swooped down to seize its prey.
The wolves separated one animal from the herd and followed it, slowly wearing down their prey until it couldn't run anymore.

es.definition: Lleno hasta el punto de desbordarse, especialmente con emociones o cualidades positivas

pt.definition: Cheio ao ponto de transbordar, especialmente com emoções ou qualidades positivas

type_word.name: Verb
type_word.description: Palabras que expresan acciones, estados o procesos.

definition: Full to the point of overflowing, especially with positive emotions or qualities
examples: Her eyes were brimming with tears.
His heart was brimming with happiness.
The bowl was brimming with fresh fruits.
The room was brimming with bright colors.
My life is brimming with possibilities.

es.definition: En gran cantidad o grado.

pt.definition: Em grande quantidade ou grau.

type_word.name: Adverb
type_word.description: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, or entire sentences.

type_word.name: Adjective
type_word.description: Words that describe or modify nouns.

definition: To a great extent or degree; a lot of.
examples: He has much more experience than I do.
How much time do we have left?
I've had so much fun with you.
My new job is much better than the old one.
Thank you very much for your help.
So much for our holiday plans.
